page.title: 11LANDSCAPE OF LINTON
page.content: On Rivey hill hedgerows are very common along the fields surrounding Linton.On top of Rivey hill the crops are mostly wheat and barley.The hilly fields roll up and down like waves in the sea.Linton looks very wooded although there are hardly any individual trees.There are at least three woods when you look around which are fairly close together.One can see the poplar trees around Linton Village College. At the bottom of Rivey hill there is a Telephone Exchange.There is a line of never ending pylons which carry electricity over Linton.In the distance one can see large silos which hold grain.Houses on the edge of Rivey hill look very modern. Linton looks very small from up here Written by:M.Taylor,S.Blow,L.Young, K.Ward,E.Appleby,M.Metzbower.
